column4: why is it when i type the cd command in terminal it tells me "rbash: cd: restricted"?
why is it when i type the cd command in terminal it tells me "rbash: cd: restricted"?
why is it when i type the cd command in terminal it tells me "rbash: cd: restricted"?
you're using the rbash envirconment which is really strict security-wise on what you can and can't do.  cd is something you aren't allowed to do evidently (or at least, not to that dir)
how do i get rid of rbash and just go back to bash?
are you an administrator on your box?
through sudo, yes
hmm, did you set rbash up yourself?
does it happen every time you open up a terminal, or just this one time?
i'm a friend of this user trying to figure out what's wrong with this pc, i had never even heard of rbash
it's every time i load up terminal
ok, then the default shell is probably set to rbash in /etc/passwd - you can edit that file for the user to set it as bash.
however, if you don't know the file, it can be dangerous to edit.
root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash
the root user there has their default shell set as bash.  Try pasting the whole contents of the file to pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/5613/
still saying restricted
hmm, the user may need to login and logout - at the very least start a new session.
did the file save correctly? You will need to use "sudo" to edit the file.
let me double-check the file, but it should work
it's also possible that the bashrc file also is wanting to load up as rbash rather than normal bash :-)
